title: Marinara 'N Mozz Meatballs
description: Gluten Free, Low Carb / Diabetes Friendly, Lower Saturated Fat, Lower Sodium
cleaned_text: Marinara 'N Mozz Meatballs These are a fun spin on traditional meatballs that will be a hit at your next summer get together. Serves: 29 per 1 toothpick Ingredients Meatballs - 1 - 15 ounce can great northern beans, drained and rinsed - 19 ounces extra lean ground turkey breast - 2 egg whites - ½ cup whole wheat breadcrumbs (use gluten free for GF version) - 1 - 4 ounce can sliced mushrooms, drained and chopped - ¼ cup grated Parmesan - 2 Tablespoons Italian seasoning - 1 Tablespoon crushed red pepper - 1 Tablespoon garlic powder - 1 Tablespoon onion powder - Cooking spray Sauce - 1/3 cup finely chopped onion - 1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil - 2 - 8 ounce cans no salt added tomato sauce - ¼ Tablespoon Italian seasoning - 2 teaspoons Splenda® brown sugar blend Plating - 14 ounces fresh part-skim mozzarella cheese, cubed - 28 fresh basil leaves Directions - Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. - Mash beans in a large mixing bowl. Add turkey breast, egg whites, bread crumbs, mushrooms, Parmesan, herbs and spices. Combine well. - Roll into one inch balls, place on sprayed baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes. - In a small saucepan, sauté onions in olive oil for 2-3 minutes on medium heat. Add the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer 6-8 minutes or until slightly thickened. - Place meatball, mozzarella cube and basil leaf on a toothpick. Drizzle with marinara sauce.
